tk.hugo4715.learn4j.classifier

Interface Classifier<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    KNearestClassifier, NearestCentroidClassifier, PerceptronClassifier

    public interface Classifier<T>

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Map<Label<T>,Double> classify(double[] point)
      Classify a new point using this classifier
      boolean isFuzzy()
      Check if the classifier is fuzzy A fuzzy classifier is a classifier that shows probability associated with the label it choose
      default Label<T> mostProbable(double[] point)
      Usefull method if you only care about the most probable result

    • Method Detail

      • mostProbable

        default Label<T> mostProbable(double[] point)
        Usefull method if you only care about the most probable result
        Parameters:
        point - The point
        Returns:
        The most probable label

      • classify

        Map<Label<T>,Double> classify(double[] point)
        Classify a new point using this classifier
        Parameters:
        point - The point
        Returns:
        A map of labels, with the associated probabilities If the classifier is not fuzzy, the map values are only 1 and 0 There is no obligation to return label with a probability of 0

      • isFuzzy

        boolean isFuzzy()
        Check if the classifier is fuzzy A fuzzy classifier is a classifier that shows probability associated with the label it choose
        Returns:
        True if fuzzy
